thread.title: Sneak peek at the Astros' new spring training facility
thread.title_full: Sneak peek at the Astros' new spring training facility

author: Matt Young
title: Sneak peek at the Astros' new spring training facility
text:
Image 1 of 20 PHOTOS: A sneak peek at the Astros' new spring training facility Workers walk past the Houston Astros team logo outside an entrance at the Ballpark of the Palm Beaches, the new spring training facility for the Astros and Washington Nationals, Monday, Feb. 13, 2017, in West Palm Beach, Fla. Astros pitchers and catchers are scheduled to report Tuesday. (AP Photo/David J. A look at the Houston Astros' new spring training complex in West Palm Beach, Fla. Photo: Jake Kaplan Sneak peek at the Astros' new spring training facility 1 / 20 Back to Gallery 
Fans won't be allowed to step foot in the Astros' new spring training facility until Saturday, but the Houston Chronicle got a quick sneak peek Monday. 
Astros' pitchers and catchers report to the team's new digs in West Palm Beach, Fla., on Tuesday and will have their first workouts Wednesday. The team has their first full-squad workouts with pitchers, catchers and position players on Saturday - the same day the facility will be open to the general public. 
It's fresh start for the Astros as they move into The Ballpark of the Palm Beaches - a $150 million complex they will share with the Washington Nationals. 
The Astros have six practice fields on the 160-acre facility. Both the Astros and Nationals have a field with the exact configurations as Minute Maid Park and Nationals Park back home. 
Browse throught the photos above for a look at the Astros' new spring training facility.
